[19-Nov-21 05:33 PM] ApexChat#8127
**StelioKontos**:	@Blake1216 I go over the optimum strategies in the #bidding-info channel - the reserve price is the maximum price for the total amount of materials. The maximum bid is 1.25x that amount


[19-Nov-21 05:34 PM] ApexChat#8127
**StelioKontos**:	The best strategy is to bid your 'true value' - if you bid less than this, it's a price you're unwilling to accept for the goods - if you bid more than this, you risk losing the bid for a price you were willing to accept


[19-Nov-21 05:34 PM] ApexChat#8127
**StelioKontos**:	Make sense?


[19-Nov-21 05:34 PM] ApexChat#8127
**StelioKontos**:	https://discord.gg/FzEtZC7RHP

**OyVader**:	How do the auctions work?


[22-Dec-21 08:15 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Lokiorin**:	@OyVader you join the discord which Stelio can send you a link too.  There are instructions for each auction.  The basic process is you send in your bid encrypted, then when the auction is closed validate the bid.  Winners are determined by the lowest cost supplier but the final price paid is the "first losing" bid price.  It's a great way to make some cash if you're operating in areas that Vallis needs

[23-Dec-21 11:17 AM] ApexChat#8127
**StelioKontos**:	https://corporatefinanceinstitute.com/resources/knowledge/other/vickrey-auction/

{Embed}
https://corporatefinanceinstitute.com/resources/knowledge/other/vickrey-auction/
Vickrey Auction
A Vickrey auction is a sealed-bid auction where bidders submit bids without knowing the bids of other people. However, as opposed to other sealed-bid
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/dxjN9dm4v2vU6zqkNnPS0wb29qb4yRHCTaMsBDFyZ58/https/cdn.corporatefinanceinstitute.com/assets/vickrey-auction2-1024x323.jpeg


[23-Dec-21 11:17 AM] ApexChat#8127
**StelioKontos**:	one you've read that, it's very simple... we use our discord bot to facilitate accepting/verifying bids


[23-Dec-21 11:18 AM] ApexChat#8127
**StelioKontos**:	and technically our auction is a "reverse-auction" - so rather than bidding to buy a certain good, your bidding on a price to sell certain goods at


[23-Dec-21 11:19 AM] ApexChat#8127
**StelioKontos**:	so in this case, rather than the highest bid winning (like a normal auction), in a reverse auction the lowest bids win


[23-Dec-21 11:19 AM] ApexChat#8127
**StelioKontos**:	You're affectively saying "I'm willing to sell you x MAT for $total" when you place a bid


[23-Dec-21 11:21 AM] ApexChat#8127
**StelioKontos**:	That said, I'm thinking of moving to a more open-reverse-market model, so everyone can participate without worrying about auction timings, availability, etc


[23-Dec-21 11:22 AM] ApexChat#8127
**StelioKontos**:	As upkeep quantities are skyrocketing, it makes more sense to have a system like this than periodic material injections (current auctions)


[23-Dec-21 11:22 AM] ApexChat#8127
**StelioKontos**:	So over this next week, I'll be playing around with creating an inventory sheet everyone can look at to determine what we need


[23-Dec-21 11:22 AM] ApexChat#8127
**StelioKontos**:	and we'll use an algorithm dependent on CX pricing to determine the purchase price

**Xenogenic**:	Actual picture of Vallis: https://starcitizen.fandom.com/wiki/Smog_planet

{Embed}
https://starcitizen.fandom.com/wiki/Smog_planet
Smog planet
Composed largely of atmospheric pollutants ejected into the atmosphere by too close proximity to the sun or other astronomical factors, smog planets are totally unsuitable for habitat. For some, the atmosphere is so corrosive that a ship without proper protection would dissolve within minutes. If this corrosivity remains limited, and if you have...
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/5bsIwz-4Hap_-khlMplHWfUn6jDZB13r1-HqqwpcYo0/%3Fcb%3D20200614183045/https/static.wikia.nocookie.net/starcitizen/images/f/f8/Smog_planet.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/1200

[22-Feb-22 01:19 PM] ApexChat#8127
**stilrz**:	From the above conversation demolishing my collector plant in favor of  feo extraction my be better.


[22-Feb-22 01:20 PM] ApexChat#8127
**GhostXD**:	Nothing. You might lose some fabs, based on the amount it says you can reclaim.


[22-Feb-22 01:21 PM] ApexChat#8127
**PawnStorm**:	When you open your list of buildings in the base it shows the material reclaimable upon demolishment.


[22-Feb-22 01:22 PM] ApexChat#8127
**PawnStorm**:	And do kill the collector, wrong planet for collecting O.


[22-Feb-22 01:22 PM] ApexChat#8127
**stilrz**:	great -- looked it up -- fully repaired building has not cost. Mine is lightly used so it will cost 1 BSE and 3 MSG


[22-Feb-22 01:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**stilrz**:	one more day to collect 20H


[22-Feb-22 01:27 PM] ApexChat#8127
**stilrz**:	... and if not producing I would have no labor costs?


[22-Feb-22 01:28 PM] ApexChat#8127
**CptWaffles**:	Your population will consume consumables regardless of production


[22-Feb-22 01:29 PM] ApexChat#8127
**CptWaffles**:	So you would have labour costs :)

**CapitanIncognito**:	POW is power cells


[22-Feb-22 01:56 PM] ApexChat#8127
**ButaneTheDwarfKing**:	PWO = padded work overalls (PIO consumable), PT=Power Tools (SETs Consumable) POW=Power Cell, input material.

[26-May-22 01:57 PM] ApexChat#8127
**stackem**:	Consider logistics when you do that. You can only move 183 FEO per ship, so If you want to do major manufacturing you need to account for that. As well, more jumps is more fuel and more ship repairs


[26-May-22 01:58 PM] ApexChat#8127
**stackem**:	You can consider that if it's one jump, or not much consumption. But much more of either condition is a recipe for a bad time


[26-May-22 02:00 PM] ApexChat#8127
**stackem**:	So there are planets with better concentrations of FEO, but they are usually inconveniently far away or underdeveloped by comparison. Convenience dictates Vallis is the, if not best, least bad FEO


[26-May-22 02:16 PM] ApexChat#8127
**stilrz**:	don't be afraid of  going vertical on your production. 1) Build EXt 2) make money 3) build smelter AND buy flx, C,O to 5 days of production

**Gruff**:	Question for the metallurgy peeps on Vallis. Right now I have 1 EXT:FEO, 1 SME:FE, 1 BMP:PE, 1 PP1:BDE. [30-Jul-22 08:16 AM] ApexChat#8127
***afi** left.*


[30-Jul-22 08:17 AM] ApexChat#8127
**illiterati1**:	Both ALO and AL are fairly light compared to FE so you could probably keep that going a while, particularly if you invested in PP2s. Sell a load in BEN every so often for cheaper SF. At some point it will become prohibitive to move, but you should have decent reserves by that point to expand elsewhere.


[30-Jul-22 08:21 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Gruff**:	what do you mean by prohibitive to move?


[30-Jul-22 08:25 AM] ApexChat#8127
**illiterati1**:	As in you can't move enough ore/metal to keep things running

**ricepowah**:	my current workforce say 160(49) does anyone know why?


[01-Oct-22 02:19 PM] ApexChat#8127
***Rebelspy101** left.*


[01-Oct-22 03:47 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Olou**:	the (49) means that you pull that many workers from the planetary pool. There is a portion of workers reserved in the pool for new buildings. Once the pop report for the planet hit it will either fill all your workers if there is enough or evenly redistribute them among all players

[03-Oct-22 02:55 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Soulvenom**:	If i bought something from the CXL I need to go pick it up correct?


[03-Oct-22 02:55 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Hoppie**:	Correct


[03-Oct-22 02:55 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Soulvenom**:	Thnx


[03-Oct-22 03:01 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Soulvenom**:	This simulator is incredibly detailed


[03-Oct-22 03:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DrTom**:	Atually no. You need place for it (you can rent warehouse space)


[03-Oct-22 03:06 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DrTom**:	and the goods need to be moved where you want them - but you do not have to do that yourself, you can put up a contract to have someone do it.


[03-Oct-22 03:33 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Rubicate**:	Even if you don't have a warehouse the CX will hold onto your commodities for free until you get there


[03-Oct-22 03:33 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Rubicate**:	when your ship arrives, you have to find the contract for the commodities (one is created automatically when you bought) and resolve it to have the goods pop into your ship


[03-Oct-22 03:35 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Soulvenom**:	Thank you both

[01-Mar-23 03:09 PM] ApexChat#8127
**purpdrag**:	I make a fairly consistent profit off of faction contracts although not a large profit.  Only about 10% of the time do I reject all three.  Provision contracts are the ones most likely to turn a profit and it is fairly easy to calculate profit based on CX prices and I don't go out of my way for it just accept if I can profit from buying it on my next scheduled CX trip.  Sometimes I do a combo of buy some and produce some.  Anyway, that is my take.  Shipping/exploration contracts are rarely worth it but have worked a few times for small profits.  Even then only worth it because it was "on the way" to somewhere I was already going anyway.  Honestly barely worth it to just land and take off somewhere usually, but I made a profit nonetheless even after fuel and damage costs.

**Lacyluc**:	Hi i am new here. Is there anything i need to pay attention to?


[21-Mar-23 04:17 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	OneTry (OneCon)'s prices!


[21-Mar-23 04:18 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	Danakil is primarily a Construction world, you hence get a bonus for building prefabs such as BSE, BBH, BDE


[21-Mar-23 04:19 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	to build these items you will have to import most of the goods


[21-Mar-23 04:20 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	all give about the same profit at the moment and all sell well


[21-Mar-23 04:21 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	if you let us know what your starting profession is we can help and guide


[21-Mar-23 04:22 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	a top tip is to sell all the SF fuel from your second ship at the CX in Moria to rasie extra cash


[21-Mar-23 04:23 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	you will not need the cargo space from the second ship for a few weeks


[21-Mar-23 04:23 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	You will need the FF fuel however so dont sell that


[21-Mar-23 04:25 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	if you decide to go PRO then there a lots of opportunities to do cargo runs.  Especially shipping goods from Moria CX to Danakil


[21-Mar-23 04:27 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	as a general rule none of the resources on Danakil are worth extracting/mining.  This does make Danakil a difficult world to start on, if you get building prefabs quickly you will prosper but otherwise it will be slow


[21-Mar-23 04:56 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	with this game, cash flow is very important.  Dont spend all your money on expanding, you need consumer goods to keep the factories working so make certain you have enough cash for the next purchase


[21-Mar-23 05:05 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	im appear to be going very crazy, this is the Vallis chat and I thought it was Danakil!!

[21-Mar-23 05:09 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	for Vallis,  build FEO extractor and SME to get started with FE.  Add SME until you have sufficient SME to use all your FEO.  Build PP1 to turn FE into Prefabs.


[21-Mar-23 05:11 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	SI is currently the most profitable metal to smelt


[21-Mar-23 05:12 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	FE is not very profitable but is always in high demand


[21-Mar-23 05:16 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	buy O it is not efficient to collect O on Vallis

**Cervus**:	Should you have a planet near CX for all of your manufacturing, or should you put refining/manufacturing on planets that make the raw resources?


[01-Apr-23 08:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**--SCHAITR--**:	Depends on your shipping capacity - the more shipping you can spare, the further out you can build


[01-Apr-23 08:24 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Carefulrogue**:	And if you have the contacts who will buy off you locally elsewhere.


[01-Apr-23 08:24 PM] ApexChat#8127
**--SCHAITR--**:	Some players try to have everything in the production chain in the same base to simplify logistics, while others try to take full advantage of the CoGC production bonus (i.e. only build the specific industry on that planet)


[01-Apr-23 08:25 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Carefulrogue**:	Room to experiment too.  I would shy away from suggesting there's one strategy that will work without fail.


[01-Apr-23 08:25 PM] ApexChat#8127
**--SCHAITR--**:	Assuming you smelt your own FE on Vallis, it may make more sense to expand into the construction industry on planet even thought the CoGC is for metallurgy simply because moving FE is a pain

[18-Apr-23 03:03 PM] ApexChat#8127

[18-Apr-23 04:01 PM] ApexChat#8127

[18-Apr-23 04:03 PM] ApexChat#8127

[24-Apr-23 06:59 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Glitchinthemaschine**:	I personally started as a Constructor on Vallis. If you wanna go full on BBH BSE etc then montem COULD be better, but it's chem focused for the moment. On the otherhand, importing LST is cheaper than importing Iron from the weight factor. Take the first days to look around a bit, see how the market and your own produktion works, and if you feel you ran yourself in a corner, you can just COLIQ and restart on montem


[24-Apr-23 07:00 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Glitchinthemaschine**:	And most people in the Global and Lokal chats are happy to help with questions normally :)

**Arcetro**:	so where do expansion play at? How is the expansion mindset in this?


[15-May-23 12:04 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BlackAnthrax**:	so technically the expansion is limited by your numbers of permits (you start with 2 permits)


[15-May-23 12:04 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Arcetro**:	oh


[15-May-23 12:04 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Arcetro**:	at what point you need PRO?


[15-May-23 12:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BlackAnthrax**:	the first permit on a planet grants you 500 area, the 2nd one 250 and the 3rd one also 250 .. to a max of 1000


[15-May-23 12:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Arcetro**:	then PRO?


[15-May-23 12:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BlackAnthrax**:	IIRC HQ level 5 is achievable without PRO. let me check really quick


[15-May-23 12:06 PM] ApexChat#8127
***Alblaka** joined.*

[15-May-23 12:06 PM] ApexChat#8127

[15-May-23 12:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Alblaka**:	Hayo :D


[15-May-23 12:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BlackAnthrax**:	yeah HQ max level without PRO is 5. so you can have 6 permits.. generally as you can see it's better to use a permit to create bases at new planets. but bear in mind that as a beginner it might make sense to just build up to 1000 area on your starter and eventually tear stuff down to use the permits for other planets


[15-May-23 12:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	But you keep all HQ upgrades if you revert back to Basic after one month of PRO.  So if you are not rl wealthy, you can build a stock of pfabs, go PRO, upgrade HQ


[15-May-23 12:13 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Arcetro**:	thats actually a great tip. How corps/clans work here?


[15-May-23 12:13 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Alblaka**:	They kinda don't. As in, there's no real functionality to them, except the corp tag at the start, and for distributing governeur taxes (which in turn means that 99% of all planetary governeuers 'leave' their corp to make a dedicate one to make tax accounting easier)

[16-May-23 01:38 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Mnementh**:	@Tek_Sten: dunno if your problem is solved already, but if you still need your inventory you can look to the left side of the screen, it has multiple buttons, click on the one titled 'BS' (Bases), which opens an overview of all your bases which for you currently is only the one, there click on view base and you get a view with multiple buttons, one of which is inventory. You can drag and drop the content of your buffers into an empty area of your screens to have it there permanently.

[22-May-23 06:58 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MrfkngToxic**:	did a youtube search not finding it, can someone point me to a tut on how to build a new ship, i am pro license


[22-May-23 07:02 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Mnementh**:	I am currently planning the same, so I start looking into it. You can type BLU in a buffer, there you can design your new ship. Your starter ship is already there as a blueprint. On Pallada is a shipyard, once you have designed your blueprint, you can go to the shipyard (SHY OT-580d) and select your blueprint. You need the parts fly to Pallada. To save you can upgrade your current ship, by selecting the starting blueprint and the target blueprint.


[22-May-23 07:02 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Mnementh**:	https://handbook.apex.prosperousuniverse.com/tutorials/legacy-tutorials/shipbuilding/

[23-Jun-23 05:00 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Harmakhis**:	Hi I'm new. If I want to buy materials to build a second extractor, can I buy those materials on the market somewhere?


[23-Jun-23 05:00 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BlackAnthrax**:	Welcome Harmakhis


[23-Jun-23 05:00 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BlackAnthrax**:	well, as a free user you will have to trade at a commodity exchange (cx for short)


[23-Jun-23 05:01 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BlackAnthrax**:	so you need to fly a ship to the CX and buy your stuff there and fly it back to the planet.


[23-Jun-23 05:02 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BlackAnthrax**:	on the left hand side of the screen you can see the button CXL . this is the list of all CXes . the closest one to us is NC1 (Moria) which is in the same system


[23-Jun-23 05:03 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Harmakhis**:	I see the moria window


[23-Jun-23 05:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BlackAnthrax**:	on the bottom there's this line with the button "new bfr" and then the numbered windows. on new bfr you can type commands to open windows directly without going through all the clicks.. this is a more advanced use which you will learn over rime


[23-Jun-23 05:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BlackAnthrax**:	*Time


[23-Jun-23 05:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BlackAnthrax**:	so for example if you want to buy rations you can type "cxob RAT.NC1" to see the offers and requests for rations on moria station


[23-Jun-23 05:07 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Harmakhis**:	I'm entering in a new window and getting "illegal command"

[18-Jul-23 07:36 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Guzzette**:	If I want something urgent then I up it to 100 NCC per weight/volume


[18-Jul-23 07:37 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Guzzette**:	most couriers take one or two big paying contracts to ship, then the fill up their spare capacity with the smaller lower paying contacts to maximise the income on their trip

[03-Sep-23 03:40 PM] ApexChat#8127
**dakota1234**:	the bullwhip effect is an actively unsolved problem: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bullwhip_effect

{Embed}
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bullwhip_effect
Bullwhip effect
The bullwhip effect is a supply chain phenomenon where orders to suppliers tend to have a larger variability than sales to buyers, which results in an amplified demand variability upstream. In part, this results in increasing swings in inventory in response to shifts in consumer demand as one moves further up the supply chain. The concept first ...
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/Tiv1c4WXvOACiM5WQuazdXgdbBGFXWgu9Ri79NC8ljk/https/upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/7/7f/Bullwhip_effect.png

[24-Sep-23 03:49 AM] ApexChat#8127

[24-Sep-23 03:50 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Kirk_Peppers**:	As far as I know it doesn't count the materials you produce in the income category in any way until you sell them

**Kirk_Peppers**:	And as for the bases I think it doesn't count any materials you produce yourself or recieve in the faction contracts but if you buy the materials on the commodity exchange it will count it in the fixed assets "bases sections" part


[24-Sep-23 03:52 AM] ApexChat#8127

[25-Sep-23 08:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Eloyen**:	Hey! Started playing like a week ago, and yesterday when I logged out I had a Finance Result of like +30 000 NCC. But today when I logged in it shows at -1 200 and I only se 4 Recent Cash Transactions so I cant see why it dipped 30 000. Anyone know what happened to my money? :P Did I miss something?


[25-Sep-23 08:44 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	The Financial result is a Calculation of revenue minus expenditure, it is calculated in real time but it is reset to zero every week.  Reset happens on Sunday so the value you are now seeing is only you purchases and sales from the last 24hrs


[25-Sep-23 08:45 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	You have not lost any money.


[25-Sep-23 09:06 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Eloyen**:	Aah, very nice! I though "Result" was how much NCC I have, not now when I look at ti again I guess my money is "Current Assets"?


[25-Sep-23 09:17 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	Yup current assets is your current cash, the game does an exchange rate calculation on cash in other denominations.  As a new start you will have a thousand in each other coin type

[09-Oct-23 09:08 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MasterYinShu**:	What's the diffrence between NC1 and NC2?


[09-Oct-23 09:08 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	The location.  They refer to the two commodity exchanges in the NEO Charter Faction.  The NC1 exchange is located at Moria station and the NC2 exchange is located in Hubur Station.  For reference, Hubur station is on the far outskirts and therefore, little used.

[10-Oct-23 02:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**starWanderer**:	and O


[10-Oct-23 02:06 PM] ApexChat#8127
**YuriYB**:	As a beginner who tried to farm C myself: I can't recommend it, unless you have a base on Verdant or similar already. O is easy enough, just set up some collectors, done. But for C you first have to builds rigs for the water, then grow your crops, then incinerate them. It's a huge investment with low return on Vallis. Especially if you're specialised in something else and have your experts working there. In the end i dismanteled everything and switched to scaling up my PP1 productions. But thats just my opinion :)


[10-Oct-23 02:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**starWanderer**:	Yes, of course. But i do that before Verdant and it works

[27-Nov-23 04:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	Currently the corporation structure is really just a way for individuals to share a chat channel.  The devs may have future plans to expand the corp capabilities.  You can invite people to join a corp but the corp itself does not have any assets.  The corp is a bit different if you are governor but still of limited usefulness.


[27-Nov-23 04:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Omegano**:	Don't forget the Headquarters, which can be built on a planet and all CORP members get a bonus to efficiency on that planet.


[27-Nov-23 04:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	Yes, that's right as well.

[27-Nov-23 07:21 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Age-Kahn**:	All the taxes and fees get paid to the corp of which the governor is a part. So by forming your own corp as governor, and being the only company in it, you receieve all the taxes and fees. It just makes financially managing a planet much easier

[11-Dec-23 07:09 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Age-Kahn**:	@metalnickle402 I am guessing you started out in metallurgy. I went with the PP1 because then I could take the FE and turn it into various bfabs which I could use to expand my own base or sell for more profit than FE alone. If you go with the BMP, it requires more expensive workers and you'll have to buy and import various materials. With a pp1 you'd mostly have to import LST to start to make good money which is easy to do on Vallis, Montem, and MOR

[13-Dec-23 10:45 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Age-Kahn**:	You have to have a blueprint to build a new ship or a "target" blueprint to upgrade. It basically says what you are going to build or upgrade to. So you have to create the blueprint to match what your final ship will look like and then the blueprint tells you what parts you need and lets you start the building project

[15-Dec-23 01:18 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	Does it make sense to incorporate steel production early on? (like, my company is 3 days old kind of early)


[15-Dec-23 01:18 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Sigmundth**:	I assume that you are doing metallurgy, i.e. running an extractor and smelter for iron production?


[15-Dec-23 01:18 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Sigmundth**:	If that is the case, then getting a collector to provide for your oxygen needs is helpful and the excess can be used to make steel.


[15-Dec-23 01:18 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Sigmundth**:	one other thing is that you should go and get flux [FLX] from the commodity exchange since buying carbon is likely to be a significant cost early on and flux will reduce the amount of carbon required for a given amount of iron.


[15-Dec-23 01:18 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Sigmundth**:	You might also want to get the nonessential workforce needs, [COF] and [PWO], in small amounts to boost your efficiency.


[15-Dec-23 01:21 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	I considered a collector but the excess, at least on the initial extractor/iron smelter combo didn't seem cost effective vs. a second extractor. It doesn't seem like a single collector on Vallis would cover STL production anyway


[15-Dec-23 01:22 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	Good tips on the FLX and luxury consumables though, I did get FLX since someone mentioned it but I didn't realize it's main value is reducing the C cost, that stuff is expensive!


[15-Dec-23 01:31 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	My other short term consideration is building a PP1 so I can produce my own base components. It seems like the ~4k price difference would even out after ~4 days and then I'd have a PP1 and another SME


[15-Dec-23 01:31 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Omegano**:	I knew that flux gave a better return for value, but it is only now that I have had it pointed out to me do I fully realize Why.


[15-Dec-23 01:31 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Omegano**:	And Construction is a good idea.


[15-Dec-23 01:31 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Omegano**:	It's the way I have gone as a Metallurgist, and it increases income A Lot.


[15-Dec-23 01:32 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Omegano**:	But, sell at least half of what you produce, or you will go bankrupt.  I started making that mistake, but managed to catch myself before it cost me.


[15-Dec-23 01:32 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	I got 100 LST.NC1 on the local market for 100/ea which helps

[21-Dec-23 06:00 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	I also recommend getting comfortable with some of the commands. I use CXOB all the time, and make sure you use all caps (because reasons), so like `CXOB FEO.NC1` oh, and make sure you're clicking on the right things. So many things are hyperlinked that if you say want to look at your inventory (INV) when the Buffer opens the "Open" action button is hidden so you'll naturally click the location name and that opens up details on the location

[03-Jan-24 08:36 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	Hello Vallis - For the new players, I'm the governor of Vallis.  So I'm responsible for maintaining the planet's infrastructure and running planetary programs.  Most of this takes place in the background and you might not notice it ingame.  Many of you are likely aware, that most planets operate at a deficit, so the tax revenue is lower than the expense of running the planet.  This is true of Vallis as well.  I would like to increase the taxes over the next 2-3 months to reach a breakeven tax rate.  I believe the impact to each player will be very small and perhaps negligible.  This is an open topic for us to discuss so please post thoughts, responses and questions in this chat so that everyone can see them.


[03-Jan-24 09:10 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Fero**:	By taxes you mean the production taxes?


[03-Jan-24 09:10 AM] ApexChat#8127

[03-Jan-24 09:10 AM] ApexChat#8127

[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	What kind of a deficit are we talking about WRT to Vallis? And what kind of increase would we need? My production fees are ~2% so even if they doubled I don't think it would be a huge impact


[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	Are fees a flat rate across industries? i.e. could we keep fees low on say metallurgy, but raise them more on construction?


[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	(or vice versa, to encourage more diversity)


[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	oh I see! Yes


[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	I would like to spread out the increase over a couple of months so we have some ability to adjust.


[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	Yes, you can change fees for certain industries but I would rather keep them all the same for each worker group (All PIO same fee, All SET same fee...)


[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	Ultimately, I think we need about a 25% increase in fees for breakeven.  Keep in mind that the fees are a set currency amount rather than as a % of something.  So as the game experiences currency inflation from market makers or new players, the taxes do not automatically compensate for this.


[03-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	So the process will continue.  Once we get it to breakeven, then very shortly after it will start to run at a deficit and that deficit will grow over time, and then we will need another tax rate reset.


[03-Jan-24 11:55 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	@DYSIODE, so you have 1 base and it is on Vallis, your 2% production fees might rise to 2.5% after the revisions.


[03-Jan-24 12:29 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Age-Kahn**:	Across my 17 permits in 8 bases, I pay 65k in taxes per week, but I make several mil a week so increasing the taxes will be negligible.


[03-Jan-24 12:29 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Age-Kahn**:	Our focus as citizens of Vallis should be on making sure the income for the governor is stable enough to support the planet long-term.

[04-Jan-24 12:22 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	@kralhex so the game is set-up so that the player that is the governor receives the tax revenue from the planet.  Technically, it's a special purpose corp in most cases in which the player is the only member but that's doesn't really matter.  So the governor receives the tax revenue personally, I get some amount of NCC every month.  Then the governor is responsible for using that money to pay for government expenses.  So when there is a deficit, it is funded by the player that is the governor.


[04-Jan-24 12:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	Being governor is kind of like having a base that you run but rather than making money everyday it loses money every day.


[04-Jan-24 12:24 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	Most governors understand this and accept it as part of the gig, but sometimes the deficit can get a little out of hand, in which case we just have to make a minor adjustment to the tax rate.


[04-Jan-24 12:59 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	The O and C that I sell on planet is not really related to the revenue and expenses of governorship.  Just trying to help people out beyond running the government.


[04-Jan-24 12:59 PM] ApexChat#8127

**DYSIODE**:	I started as a metallurgist, is there any particular reason to say move into AL production vs. C production? i.e. is there any intrinsic Metalurgy bonus I have because I started as one or did it just provision me with the stuff for it?


[08-Jan-24 08:55 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Strake**:	On Vallis we get a 25% bonus to metallurgy which would lean you a bit towards AL over C production. But that's because of the planet bonus. I don't think your starting package gives you any bonuses, just the materials for that set of starting buildings


[08-Jan-24 10:17 PM] ApexChat#8127
***userc5cd955c0c** left.*

[08-Jan-24 10:30 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Omegano**:	Yeah, it does.  So you are starting with to Metallurgy experts. You could get other experts over time, but the two are a good bonus at the start,


[08-Jan-24 10:31 PM] ApexChat#8127

[11-Jan-24 05:32 AM] ApexChat#8127
**starWanderer**:	@banuka Its a sandbox, you can do what you like


[11-Jan-24 10:29 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Spiotwo**:	@banuka Look at the things you can produce using pioneer buildings and then look at the CX prices to see what can be sold for most marginal profit.


[11-Jan-24 10:29 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Spiotwo**:	On vallis you mainly produce iron locally so look for recepies that use iron. Also keep in mind that some products have close to 0 demand so you basically can't sell them, look for those with high demand


[11-Jan-24 10:29 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Spiotwo**:	I recommend either building Welding plants and producing GCs (Cylindrical Gas Container), or PP1s and producing BBH and BSE. Both of those give around 2k in profits per production cycle, with the bonus that you can use the prefabs produced by PP1s to build new buildings instead of bying them on the CX.


[11-Jan-24 10:29 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Spiotwo**:	Also a large chunk off your profits probably goes to buying carbon on the CX, look into building INCs to produce it locally from plants bought on the CX, that cuts a lot of your spending


[11-Jan-24 10:29 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Spiotwo**:	A good ratio of buildings imo is 1EXT/1INC/2SME/2PP1, multiply as needed


[11-Jan-24 10:29 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MoLab**:	You would run an INC on Vallis?


[11-Jan-24 11:25 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Spiotwo**:	Well yeah the math checks out


[11-Jan-24 11:25 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MoLab**:	Yes it could have been a strategy. I waited with my INC until I had my base at Verdant. But now I think it might not matter if you transport plants to Vallis or C directly...


[11-Jan-24 11:25 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Spiotwo**:	2 SMEs take about 5C per day to operate 24/7, on the CX thats about 3k, produced locally 1INC makes ~5C per day using 4HCP+2GRN, 1.5k on the CX. So 50% reduction in cost


[11-Jan-24 11:25 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MoLab**:	Yes it makes sense, just a hydroponics farm on Vallis does not make sense because there is no water on Vallis.


[11-Jan-24 11:25 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MoLab**:	Well there is some water but little


[11-Jan-24 11:25 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MoLab**:	By the way Spiotwo, I found a contractor for the lab on vallis.


[11-Jan-24 11:25 AM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	I definitely found the PP1s most helpful, prefabs are forever in demand at a stable price and being able to go "oh, I can build another building" because you have the parts is great

**Saidjin**:	I am new as well but what worked for me was to load what I wanted to sell on a ship, fly it to the station. Then you can select the ship as the storage location

**DYSIODE**:	`WAR MOR` in a new buffer will take you to the warehouse screen. You can also get to it from the "planet" info, which is where the Local Market (if you're Pro/Basic) and other planetary services are. You'll want a warehouse to buy stuff into if you don't have a ship stationed there, for example

[24-Jan-24 08:18 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	Welcome to Vallis all new players - feel free to ask questions in this chat and we will try to help


[24-Jan-24 08:51 AM] ApexChat#8127
**YuriYB**:	what does WCB for ships stand for?


[24-Jan-24 08:51 AM] ApexChat#8127
**NgURoyalZ**:	i guess i have only two questions.. will metallurgy always be this slow? and Is it smarter to focus one one industry or to fan out into multiple ?


[24-Jan-24 08:53 AM] ApexChat#8127
**CraftsmanThirteen**:	WCB is a cargo bay kit - it is a 3,000 ton / 1,000 meter capacity - great for heavy things, not so good for light but bulky things like fuel.


[24-Jan-24 08:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**CraftsmanThirteen**:	Matallurgy - some things are slow, others arent (look at the FS) - in terms of future - good to keep to one industry per planet, so a metallurgy world (Vallis) a chemistry world (Montem), etc.


[24-Jan-24 08:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**CraftsmanThirteen**:	This is because the COGC per planet is only for one industry and gives a 25% bonus, and also Experts - each additional expert generates a better increase.


[24-Jan-24 08:55 AM] ApexChat#8127
**CraftsmanThirteen**:	Thus it is better to have 5 experts in one industry (28.4% increase) versus one in 5 different industries (15% increase)


[24-Jan-24 08:56 AM] ApexChat#8127
**NgURoyalZ**:	whats the FS ? sorry if thats a dumb question XD


[24-Jan-24 09:13 AM] ApexChat#8127
**illuineru**:	FS is a building. in a NEW BFR type BUI FS or in base construct menu > settlers.


[24-Jan-24 09:19 AM] ApexChat#8127
**NgURoyalZ**:	ohhh yea thanks first i need to even build settle habs and then we¬¥ll see from there


[24-Jan-24 09:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**CraftsmanThirteen**:	Just using that as an example that has faster recipes for Metallurgy


[24-Jan-24 11:28 AM] ApexChat#8127
***Le_Lievre** joined.*


[24-Jan-24 11:49 AM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	Important to remember these are new players :) The early game is substantially different than the game after 18 months


[24-Jan-24 11:51 AM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	That said, Metallurgy is generally pretty slow, but everything in the game is generally pretty slow, there's no sprinting (though sometimes you choose to dump fuel to get consumables back to the planet in time lol). Once you get into the rhythm it won't feel as slow


[24-Jan-24 11:52 AM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	In fact, Agriculture is even slower! MAI.NC1 takes a whole 24 hours to grow!


[24-Jan-24 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	but I'm 6 weeks in and have a new base planned that's going to take me ~10 days to build the supply for. The only way to short circuit that would be to take a loan (holla at lowstrife) which is a completely valid choice, but I personally prefer to go solo in that regard


[24-Jan-24 11:56 AM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	All said, stick to pioneer buildings for a while, there's plenty of money to be made in them, especially since you're mining your own consumables (and because FE.NC1 is reeeally high right now for some reason)


[24-Jan-24 12:00 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	Also, to Craftsman's credit, even though Vallis has O for example it's generally more expensive to produce it yourself than buy it. I use https://prunplanner.org/ to help visualize those costs (it's not super intuitive to start using but once you figure it out it's extremely helpful)


[24-Jan-24 12:31 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	oh, and one final thing to add to my mini lecture is PP1s are great even though they're not "Metallurgy" because it means you get a consistent supply of building resources you can use for yourself or sell

**Scottyy**:	Noob question :) -- I'm looking at some of my earlier buildings and their repair costs.  Example, I have a SME that is 63 days old with a condition 97.4% which has minimal impact on my production efficiency (99%).


[30-Jan-24 11:12 AM] ApexChat#8127

[30-Jan-24 11:15 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Omegano**:	At 45 or 90 days, typically.


[30-Jan-24 11:17 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Omegano**:	Note At, not after.  45 and 90 are large tick-overs, meaning you want to do it as close to that number of days but not on them.


[30-Jan-24 11:18 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Omegano**:	Or I'm getting it wrong, and it is 46 and 91 that are the large ticks.


[30-Jan-24 11:19 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Omegano**:	Anyone can confirm which it is?


[30-Jan-24 11:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	I'm not sure about the tick timing, but I typically repair at around 90 days

[07-Feb-24 09:21 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Czupurek**:	Hello, im new here. Is it worth buying materials to build a second Smelter with starting capital?


[07-Feb-24 09:39 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	I'm fairly new too, so take my advice with a grain of salt, but that's what I've been doing.  The original two extractors should be enough to provide ore for up to four FEO>FE smelters, and you get paid a lot more for FE.


[07-Feb-24 09:41 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	I've put most of my capital towards additional smelters, but they're actually split between FE and STL to maximize steel production, which pays a lot more yet.  The goal is to eventually have 4 SME for FE and 4 for STL, which convert all of the ore to steel.


[07-Feb-24 09:42 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	You have to import a crapton of oxygen to supply eight smelters though, but the economics seem to work out.


[07-Feb-24 09:44 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	my next layer is going to be BMP's producing power tools (PT), for even better margins.  I've bult my first BMP even though I have only four smelters so far, and will likely upgrade in waves to convert as much FEO into PT as possible at every step, I think that maximizes profit.

[07-Feb-24 11:14 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	I tried to extrapolate out, too.  2 FEO extractors are enough to supply 4 SMEs making FE, which can supply 4 SMEs making steel, which can supply 12 BMPs making PT, for a profit of 520k a week.  Total construction cost would be 775k including the 18 HB1's you need, and the total footprint would be 460 area, so should only require the one permit.


[07-Feb-24 11:17 AM] ApexChat#8127

O planets seem pretty far away, and I need to work through what else I can do with the oxygen. **SimonBaltzerberg**:	Dont you lose on the expert bonus if you do both metalurgy and manufacturing?


[07-Feb-24 12:01 PM] ApexChat#8127
**SimonBaltzerberg**:	@Retread


[07-Feb-24 12:06 PM] ApexChat#8127
***sethioy** left.*


[07-Feb-24 12:07 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	The bonuses seem to apply to each process separately.  My current efficiencies are 107 EXT, 152 SME and 100 BMP, but the BMPs haven't been running long enough to produce any experts yet.


[07-Feb-24 12:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**SimonBaltzerberg**:	you have limit of 6 active experts per base


[07-Feb-24 12:09 PM] ApexChat#8127
**SimonBaltzerberg**:	so once you have 5 experts in metallurgy, you wont be able to have more than one in manufacturing


[07-Feb-24 12:09 PM] ApexChat#8127
**SimonBaltzerberg**:	just something to keep in mind


[07-Feb-24 12:10 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	That's true, but but that will be a limit no matter what.  It just becomes a matter of optimizing where those six experts are placed.


[07-Feb-24 12:11 PM] ApexChat#8127
**SimonBaltzerberg**:	What I mean, alternatively you could get another base somewhere else and specialize it in manufacturing


[07-Feb-24 12:11 PM] ApexChat#8127
**SimonBaltzerberg**:	preferably somewhere, where there are some natural resourced that also could be used in manufacturing


[07-Feb-24 12:13 PM] ApexChat#8127

[15-Feb-24 11:34 AM] ApexChat#8127
**SimonBaltzerberg**:	I read some people had 8+ SME, how do you approach managing the production queue?


[15-Feb-24 11:35 AM] ApexChat#8127
**SimonBaltzerberg**:	Do you have like 2 day long production orders that end on different days?


[15-Feb-24 11:37 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	smaller scale than 8 smelters, but i have four, and the goal is to smelt all smelted iron to steel.  I figured out that to do that, I need 1.9 smelting iron and 2.1 smelting steel.


[15-Feb-24 11:37 AM] ApexChat#8127
**SimonBaltzerberg**:	Yeah, my question is how to manage production queue when you have fewer spots in the queue than numer of Smelters :)


[15-Feb-24 11:39 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	Right now, I'm approximating that ratio by having recurring orders of 1 FE to 2 STL, which gives me 2.28 FE and 1.72 ST.  Long term, once I build up enough inventory, I'll switch to 5 steel to 3 iron, which works out to 1.94 FE to 2.06 STL.


[15-Feb-24 11:40 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	It's all about getting the ratios of time right, if you can.  Then you only need one recurring order for each product.


[15-Feb-24 11:40 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	The downside is you have to carry enough inventory to be able to handle the longer production cycles.


[15-Feb-24 11:41 AM] ApexChat#8127
**SimonBaltzerberg**:	What I do with 5 smelters is i just make 5 FE orders, and then 5 double STL orders


[15-Feb-24 11:41 AM] ApexChat#8127
**SimonBaltzerberg**:	then I end up with 0 FE


[15-Feb-24 11:41 AM] ApexChat#8127
**SimonBaltzerberg**:	and start new cycle


[15-Feb-24 11:42 AM] ApexChat#8127
**SimonBaltzerberg**:	actually i do double FE and quadruple STL


[15-Feb-24 11:42 AM] ApexChat#8127
**SimonBaltzerberg**:	so that each production takes almost 24h, so that i don't have to click too often


[15-Feb-24 11:44 AM] ApexChat#8127
**SimonBaltzerberg**:	but I don't have pro so i don't have recurring orders, which makes me think i won't be able to handle more than 5 SME


[15-Feb-24 11:49 AM] ApexChat#8127
**illuineru**:	i have 12 SME. 6x2 pack 30mins apart 16-24hrs orders. alternating what i need sometimes STL AL SI.

**SimonBaltzerberg**:	ok thanks!

[18-Feb-24 01:15 PM] ApexChat#8127
**AinzOoalGown**:	How do you expand your base size? upgrading HQ?


[18-Feb-24 01:15 PM] ApexChat#8127
**AinzOoalGown**:	Im currently at 465 / 35 / 500


[18-Feb-24 01:18 PM] ApexChat#8127
**SimonBaltzerberg**:	On your BS buffor you can "ADD" permits


[18-Feb-24 01:20 PM] ApexChat#8127
**dakota1234**:	and to get more permits you have to upgrade your HQ


[18-Feb-24 01:20 PM] ApexChat#8127
**CraftsmanThirteen**:	Each additional permit only adds 250 space - so it isn't a bad thing to do while 'small" - but when you start a new base on a different planet you get 500 (minus 25) for each permit - so you get more bang for your buck by adding new planets.


[18-Feb-24 01:20 PM] ApexChat#8127
**CraftsmanThirteen**:	Also, you can only get up to 1000 space on one planet

[22-Feb-24 06:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Sparepaper894**:	Anyone know how to severly cut expenses?


[22-Feb-24 07:23 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	A few things I'd check: 1) are you making unnecessary trips?  In the beginning, limit your flights to when you need to buy supplies or when you have a full cargo hold of saleable goods.  2) are you taking unprofitable faction contracts?  Not all of them will make you money, the planetary survey ones especially rarely do.  3) Have you done the math on your profitability?  Not every production chain makes money, gotta make things that sell for more than they cost to produce and ship.


[22-Feb-24 08:00 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Sparepaper894**:	Thank you, yeah now that I do the math im making alot of unnessescary trips which is cutting into my profits. Thank you1

[22-Feb-24 04:36 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	Keep in mind the vast majority of your costs are your workforce, and as you produce more goods fuel costs will become a much smaller part of your costs. I use www.prunplanner.org to get a good estimate of what to produce (you do have to make sure there's a market for some of it!), but there's other tools to explore that as well: https://handbook.apex.prosperousuniverse.com/wiki/community-resources/index.html

{Embed}
https://handbook.apex.prosperousuniverse.com/wiki/community-resources/index.html
Community Resources :: Prosperous Universe Handbook
Prosperous Universe Wiki


[22-Feb-24 04:51 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	Interesting observation about workforce costs, it must vary a lot by industry.  My expenses for the last period were 57% materials, 28% worker supplies, 5% fuel and 5% depreciation of buildings.  The rest were under 3%.


[22-Feb-24 04:58 PM] ApexChat#8127

[26-Feb-24 09:14 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Sparepaper894**:	Anyone what wat the ACT and RMV stuff means in the expert controls?


[26-Feb-24 09:16 AM] ApexChat#8127
**banuka**:	activate and remove right?


[26-Feb-24 09:17 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Sparepaper894**:	I have no idea, its in the "experts" tab when you're viewing your base


[26-Feb-24 09:27 AM] ApexChat#8127
***Zataros** joined.*


[26-Feb-24 09:27 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	Experts improve the efficiency of your buildings by a small percentage.  As you use buildings in particular categories (eg metallurgy, manufacturing), you accumulate experts; up to five per building category.  The trick is, you can only have six total experts active on your base at any given time, so once more than six experts have arrived at your base, you have to begin choosing which ones to activate.


[26-Feb-24 09:29 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Sparepaper894**:	Ah, thank you.


[26-Feb-24 09:29 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	For example, I'm still fairly new, so I have 3 experts in each of Resource Extraction, Metallurgy and Manufacturing available, for a total of nine.  But I can only use six, so I've chosen (with the help of a spreadsheet to calculate the effect on my profitability) to use three experts each in Metallurgy and Manufacturing and let the three Resource Extraction experts sit idle.

[26-Feb-24 08:16 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Sparepaper894**:	Anyone know what providing the luxury's for your population does and what your satisfaction precentage accounts to?


[26-Feb-24 08:18 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	Luxuries make your pops more efficient.  They only produce at 100% speed when they have access to all of their consumables, basic and luxury


[26-Feb-24 08:21 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Sparepaper894**:	Hmm, I haven't really noticed that. Thank you for the info!


[26-Feb-24 08:30 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	The new order window will tell you all the efficiency factors, e.g. Pioneers, Production Line Condition, Experts, CoGC Program,


[26-Feb-24 08:31 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	if the Pioneers (or Settlers, etc...) is less than 100%, they don't have access to all of their consumables.


[26-Feb-24 08:31 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Sparepaper894**:	hmm, good to know. I'll add that to my information document


[26-Feb-24 08:33 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	You could also go to your base screen (BS OT-580c for Vallis), and then click on Workforce for a more detailed breakdown


[26-Feb-24 08:34 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Sparepaper894**:	I have the workforce window set open all the time but it doesn't really explain much to me, just abunch of technical jargen.


[26-Feb-24 08:36 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	Let's just look in the pioneers column.  Each cell in that column represents the needs of your pioneers for that resource.


[26-Feb-24 08:37 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Sparepaper894**:	And from what i've been seeing it scales up per production building you have, or so I think. My COF went from 0.6/day to 0.8/day after i've made a collector to help me save on some costs for making Iron.


[26-Feb-24 08:37 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	For example, in the DW row, it tells me that my Pioneers need 48.8 units of drinking water per day, and that their need is 100% satisfied.


[26-Feb-24 08:38 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	See the "Total" Column?  That how much of each resource you need each day to supply your workforce.


[26-Feb-24 08:39 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	when you add more buildings, they need more workforce, which needs more supplies.


[26-Feb-24 08:39 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Sparepaper894**:	Ok, now I think im starting to understand it now, thank you very much!


[26-Feb-24 08:39 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	NP


[26-Feb-24 08:40 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	As you build more production buildings, you'll also need to build more housing for your workforce


[26-Feb-24 08:41 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Sparepaper894**:	Hmm, I was thinking so. Guess anytime I add a new building I'll need to update my charts / lists I have on another tab.

**Retread**:	If you're on Vallis, a collector will not give you enough oxygen to be worthwhile.  Nor is Vallis able to sustain any agriculture.  Your best bet for now is to buy the carbon you need, build out your metallurgy base, and then set up a base elsewhere.

[04-Apr-24 09:01 AM] ApexChat#8127

[04-Apr-24 09:02 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	Iron is used primarily in making STL or BSE, BBH, BTA or you can just sell the Iron


[04-Apr-24 09:04 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	I'd suggest that you model some scenarios and choose a path forward.  Also it's very easy to tear down buildings and build new things, so don't worry so much about small mistakes or changing course in the future.

**Maximan_X**:	Hello fellow Valis people, I'm new and only just built the recommended buildings for Metallurgist, what should be my game plan moving forward?


[09-Apr-24 08:10 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	Dig up FEO, smelt it into FE.  Sell FE.  Figure out if you can turn FE into something more profitable (hint: STL).  Dig FEO, make FE, make STL, sell STL.  Build more extractors, build more smelters, figure out what else you can make with iron and steel that makes more money per day.  Fill out this base, build another, etc...

[19-Apr-24 01:07 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	Surveying involves flying to the planet with one of your ships, landing on it, opening up the contract and clicking fulfill.


[19-Apr-24 01:07 PM] ApexChat#8127
**SpectacledHusky**:	oh. I sent one of my 2 ships to Moria Station, should I keep my other one on site or fly it there?


[19-Apr-24 01:07 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	It's worth doing the math on how much fuel this will cost you, quite often survey contrracts are not worth it.


[19-Apr-24 01:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**SpectacledHusky**:	It would only be worth it if I had something to go to also in the area?

[19-Apr-24 01:09 PM] ApexChat#8127

[19-Apr-24 01:09 PM] ApexChat#8127

[19-Apr-24 01:12 PM] ApexChat#8127

[19-Apr-24 01:13 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	The ones I'm talking about come in groups of three, and you should be getting a set every 16 hours or so at the beginning.

[24-Apr-24 10:19 AM] ApexChat#8127

[24-Apr-24 10:21 AM] ApexChat#8127

[24-Apr-24 10:21 AM] ApexChat#8127

[24-Apr-24 10:23 AM] ApexChat#8127

[12-May-24 03:30 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	Are you following the tutorials?


[12-May-24 03:32 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Wolferath**:	Yes, it told me to build a couple of starting things to get production running, but now it ended (?) and I am none the wiser regarding materialsa.


[12-May-24 03:33 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	The basic loop buy inputs, process them to create products, and sell the products


[12-May-24 03:35 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	It's a slow game, once you set up that initial production, there's not much to do until it finishes.


[12-May-24 03:36 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Wolferath**:	It's building a basic bulkhead it seems.


[12-May-24 03:37 PM] ApexChat#8127
**lord_kelvin441**:	Constructor profession?


[12-May-24 03:37 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Wolferath**:	Yes


[12-May-24 03:43 PM] ApexChat#8127
**lord_kelvin441**:	Your basic materials are Iron Ore. Limestone, Oxygen and Water. Water. Water is double indirect input to Carbon which together with Oxygen is used to ore into iron, Then you combine Iron and Limestone into construction prefabs


[12-May-24 03:44 PM] ApexChat#8127
**lord_kelvin441**:	There's another loop involvin Carbon, Hydroneg and Magnesite


[12-May-24 03:44 PM] ApexChat#8127
**lord_kelvin441**:	Also, you can use some Limestone to make Flux, which increases efficiency of smelting Iron.


[12-May-24 03:45 PM] ApexChat#8127
**lord_kelvin441**:	Feel free to buy any intermediates mentioned


[12-May-24 03:51 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Wolferath**:	So. I buy things like Iron, Limestone etc?


[12-May-24 03:51 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Wolferath**:	It's not aquired by my work force?


[12-May-24 03:54 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Novachrono28**:	You can extract them too

**Shugorath**:	Hello i'm new! I was wondering (among many things, this game is a lot to learn..), how do i get a rating? so i can accept  Local Maket ADs for starter


[05-Jun-24 08:05 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Shugorath**:	I dont have much to do with my ships in the early game it seems. Maby i can do some shipping Vallis-Station? If so how?


[05-Jun-24 08:07 AM] ApexChat#8127
**illuineru**:	Rating is PRO and Basic Licences related. so accepting and creating contracts from player-to-player of local market.


[05-Jun-24 08:08 AM] ApexChat#8127
**illuineru**:	to do shipping someone hase to send you a shipping contract or u have to take them from local markets.


[05-Jun-24 08:18 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Shugorath**:	I have a free licence, so basic i guess, my rating is U. I cant take any shipping contracts on the local markets.


[05-Jun-24 08:19 AM] ApexChat#8127
**illuineru**:	basic is not free.  when your PRO expires u go down to Basic.


[05-Jun-24 08:19 AM] ApexChat#8127
**illuineru**:	https://prosperousuniverse.com/premium

{Embed}
https://prosperousuniverse.com/premium
Prosperous Universe | The Economic Space MMO
In Prosperous Universe, you are the CEO of your own spacefaring company. Explore the galaxy, design spaceships, forge alliances, and most importantly: produce, trade, transport, and profit. Manage your business through a highly customizable user interface named APEX, accessible via web browser. Contribute to a purely player-driven MMO economy in...
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/iw6GWFhfbXVxv9pGxGE1JgF_0dDoqQLVZGppgAEL7-U/https/prosperousuniverse.com/og/image.jpg


[05-Jun-24 08:21 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Shugorath**:	Oh ok, so what can i do with free licence? Ask ppl to send me a shipping contract?


[05-Jun-24 08:23 AM] ApexChat#8127
**illuineru**:	u cant accept contracts or local market add in free. think like that free is a DEMO. in free u can only have max 6 bases. if u check the link and click to see all included features.


[05-Jun-24 08:25 AM] ApexChat#8127
**illuineru**:	not 6 bases sory 6 permits. potentially 6 bases. or 2 bases with 3 permits or combinations


[05-Jun-24 08:26 AM] ApexChat#8127
**illuineru**:	u cant build ships or upgrade them.


[05-Jun-24 08:27 AM] ApexChat#8127
**illuineru**:	your only trade would be limited in Commodity Exchanges.


[05-Jun-24 08:28 AM] ApexChat#8127

[22-Jun-24 07:28 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Spiotwo**:	Yes, this planet has water, oxygen and hydrogen, but the yield is low and not worth the expense to extract it. The same can be said about farms - they'll just take up space and people better used for more extractors and smelters


[22-Jun-24 07:30 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Spiotwo**:	Your biggest raw material expense is carbon, so it makes sense to build an incinerator and buy plants to feed it, it'll cut your carbon expenses by about half


[22-Jun-24 07:31 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Spiotwo**:	For the rest - oxygen, food, water etc its best to just buy it on the CX


[22-Jun-24 07:36 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Spiotwo**:	After you earn enough you can set up prefab plants (PP1), they can take your iron and transform it into prefab parts. Those are much more easy to ship (since they are lighter) and always in demand.


[22-Jun-24 07:37 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Spiotwo**:	Thats basically the entire early game path on Vallis

[06-Jul-24 08:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**CraftsmanThirteen**:	Basically there are two paths to making C - the fast or slow recipes.  The 'slow' recipe burns HCP while the 'fast' recipe burns HCP/GRN/MAI. (fast takes twice the inputs as the slow, but is 8 hours versus 24 hours).


[06-Jul-24 08:55 AM] ApexChat#8127
**CraftsmanThirteen**:	If you decide to use the 'slow' then it is most effeicient to use a HYF (hydroponic farm building - which you can put on ANY planet) to grow HCP (8 per 9.6 hours)


[06-Jul-24 08:56 AM] ApexChat#8127
**CraftsmanThirteen**:	It costs more H2O and uses NS, but is faster - thus maximizes use of your permit space.

[09-Jul-24 11:39 PM] ApexChat#8127
**dakota1234**:	Details are here: https://pct.fnar.net/building-degradation/#walkthrough

{Embed}
https://pct.fnar.net/building-degradation/
Building Degradation - PrUn Community Derived Information
Community derived data & formulas from the game Prosperous Universe


[09-Jul-24 11:40 PM] ApexChat#8127
**dakota1234**:	tl;dr the average condition of the buildings of a type (so the average of all your smelters, for example) is applied to the orders on that line


[09-Jul-24 11:41 PM] ApexChat#8127
**dakota1234**:	so if your average repair level is 80%, all of your orders will be 80% efficient (and thus take longer)

[30-Aug-24 01:40 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Logic99**:	Common wisdom is to repair them before they reach 80% as the fall off in performance grows


[30-Aug-24 01:53 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Malinko**:	what i mean is, if its 1% it has x materials needed to repair. If its 10% damaged, does it require 10 * X to repair?


[30-Aug-24 02:46 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Logic99**:	I don't believe the fall off is linear, but I haven't tracked it that close. What most people do is to repair it before it increases travel time.


[30-Aug-24 02:52 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Malinko**:	Sorry im not being clear, does the resource cost for repairs increase linearly with damage or is it tiered or a flat rate??


[30-Aug-24 02:55 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Logic99**:	I believe it is tiered, in that it remains the same during about a 5 percent window. Each threshhold it crosses, increases it by 1 SSC and 1 BHP. I have never seen it above the 12 MFK and 8 FLP. They seem constant.


[30-Aug-24 02:55 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Logic99**:	Although I don't typically let mine go below about 88%.


[30-Aug-24 02:56 PM] ApexChat#8127
**dakota1234**:	if you dig around the community resources section of the handbook there's... somewhere, wish I could remember, where someone did a very good writeup


[30-Aug-24 02:56 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Logic99**:	Which is 5 each of BHP & SSC


[30-Aug-24 02:56 PM] ApexChat#8127
**dakota1234**:	it's nonlinear, IIRC something of an inverted s-curve


[30-Aug-24 02:56 PM] ApexChat#8127
**dakota1234**:	but weird enough that you really have to read the whole thing for it to make any sense


[30-Aug-24 02:56 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Logic99**:	What @dakota1234 said

[31-Aug-24 03:35 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Xk37**:	workforce that isn't producing anything doesn't consume anything. You starterd with 200 "free" PIO, when the consumption increased as you added production buildings.


[31-Aug-24 03:35 PM] ApexChat#8127
**starWanderer**:	BUYING up to 2k FEO per 50/u NOW. Large parties and small parties. If you see me connected - just send me a cont, pls

[31-Aug-24 03:50 PM] ApexChat#8127
**dakota1234**:	in the "WF" buffer you can check out the exact numbers and do the math yourself


[31-Aug-24 03:51 PM] ApexChat#8127
**dakota1234**:	unfortunate that it doesn't show the base rates (per 100) for any category actively being consumed tho, but you can sorta work it out backward


[31-Aug-24 03:56 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Malinko**:	yea i did that yesterday, but like you said, you cant see the ones currently consumed.  At least i have all the other ones down now


[31-Aug-24 04:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Malinko**:	good thing i sent a ship to the station yesterday, it should make it back before they run out


[31-Aug-24 04:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	Your consumption is based on your `Current` workforce numbers. Your Housing is just an indication of how many workers you CAN have, but if you don't have any production facilities that need them you won't hire up to the capacity


[31-Aug-24 04:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	Also, you do still have to feed your workers even if your production lines are idle


[31-Aug-24 04:10 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DYSIODE**:	But you also are returned all the resources used to build a facility minus the repair cost, so if you're expecting to leave a production line idle for a while you can dismantle the building at effectively no cost


[31-Aug-24 04:16 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Malinko**:	good tip, thanks.

[03-Sep-24 09:21 AM] ApexChat#8127
**dakota1234**:	FIO has building degredation (https://pct.fnar.net/building-degradation/) but not ships for some reason

{Embed}
https://pct.fnar.net/building-degradation/
Building Degradation - PrUn Community Derived Information
Community derived data & formulas from the game Prosperous Universe


[03-Sep-24 09:22 AM] ApexChat#8127
**--SCHAITR--**:	(100% - current ship condition) * total hull plates = hull plate cost (round up)


[03-Sep-24 09:22 AM] ApexChat#8127
**--SCHAITR--**:	Same for SSC


[03-Sep-24 09:22 AM] ApexChat#8127
**--SCHAITR--**:	Then a flat 12 MFK and 8 FLP

**Delta38**:	how does one send out ships for supply runs and for contracts?


[07-Sep-24 09:35 AM] ApexChat#8127
**dakota1234**:	if you open a FLT buffer you can access your ships - and then on the right under "commands" there's "fly"


[07-Sep-24 09:36 AM] ApexChat#8127
**dakota1234**:	then you select a destination, adjust the fuel sliders (generally you want FTL fuel all the way to the left) and hit "go"

[09-Sep-24 10:39 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Isoroku**:	They are usually worth it


[09-Sep-24 10:41 PM] ApexChat#8127
**astroninja221**:	it also sometimes depends on if you care for the extra hastle. Using luxury items for me right now changes my ROI by 5 days, but it's more to remember


[09-Sep-24 10:41 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Isoroku**:	They look expensive, but you usually need fewer in quantity, so it works out. The additional efficiency, and reduced production time are worth unless you have to prioritize inputs for some reason

**Malinko**:	why would we not want to bring scientists in when there are open jobs for them?


[04-Oct-24 09:56 PM] ApexChat#8127
**--SCHAITR--**:	Since I have reduced the POPI levels to cull the unemployed PIOs and SETs, we do not have enough to keep our SCI. I'm selectively using immigration programs for ENG/SCI to keep the numbers stable.


[04-Oct-24 09:56 PM] ApexChat#8127
**--SCHAITR--**:	This method still saves us on expenses since we don't spend as much on POPI inputs.


[04-Oct-24 09:57 PM] ApexChat#8127
**--SCHAITR--**:	Once we have stablised the populations, I will look into reducing the taxes, especially for the lower tiers (we're a starter planet afterall)

[04-Dec-24 10:06 PM] ApexChat#8127
**realbandit**:	Maxing your first base to 500 area is going to be the easiest option, then you can choose to add another 250 area or expand to another planet.


[04-Dec-24 10:07 PM] ApexChat#8127
**LINKZ**:	so 250 will use a permit?>


[04-Dec-24 10:07 PM] ApexChat#8127
**realbandit**:	Montem is a good option, and has the LST for B-Fabs, you could also look at Danakil (OT-442b) which can often be closer if Montem/Vallis are opposite in their orbits - Danakil runs construction CoGC


[04-Dec-24 10:07 PM] ApexChat#8127
**realbandit**:	yes, the 250 expansion uses a permit


[04-Dec-24 10:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**LINKZ**:	okay and is it 500 for a base? or depending on location?


[04-Dec-24 10:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**realbandit**:	Depends if you want to be self sufficient or optimise for efficiency


[04-Dec-24 10:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**realbandit**:	each new base gives 500 (technically 475 because CM)


[04-Dec-24 10:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**realbandit**:	500 everywhere


[04-Dec-24 10:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**realbandit**:	different planet cost different building materials (INS, HSE, etc)


[04-Dec-24 10:09 PM] ApexChat#8127
**realbandit**:	Vallis, Montem, and Danakil are all T1 (only MCG)

[04-Dec-24 10:12 PM] ApexChat#8127

[04-Dec-24 10:12 PM] ApexChat#8127

[04-Dec-24 10:12 PM] ApexChat#8127

[04-Dec-24 10:13 PM] ApexChat#8127
**realbandit**:	CORPs will give you more collaborating options, and more communication with buyers/sellers - most corps also have a planet with a corp HQ for a 10% bonus (can only be built on 1 planet per corp)


[04-Dec-24 10:14 PM] ApexChat#8127
**realbandit**:	Some corps run a HQ on Verdant for the 10% bonus there

**realbandit**:	max of 6 experts total


[04-Dec-24 10:15 PM] ApexChat#8127

[04-Dec-24 10:16 PM] ApexChat#8127

[10-Dec-24 01:09 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Pomme_de_Terroriste**:	Sure. PMMG/RPrUn are both browser plugins that offer a number of quality of life features.


[10-Dec-24 01:10 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Pomme_de_Terroriste**:	Refined PrUn is kind of PMMG+, it just recently launched. PMMG is a longstanding plugin.


[10-Dec-24 01:11 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Pomme_de_Terroriste**:	FIO is a data aggregator plugin that pulls from the game and can feed exterior sources, such as Prunplanner. Linking the two will allow it to do things like factor in your inventory for building/maintenance/etc.

[12-Dec-24 01:58 PM] ApexChat#8127
**CyberKrakenOriginal**:	If supply is too high the price will lower in order to increase demand, if the demand is too high the price will raise to decrease demand


[12-Dec-24 01:59 PM] ApexChat#8127
**CyberKrakenOriginal**:	If nobody is buying that's low demand and high supply, so the price crashes


[12-Dec-24 02:00 PM] ApexChat#8127

[12-Dec-24 02:00 PM] ApexChat#8127
**AtomicScience**:	Yeah, but I'm afraid of a positive feedback loop there

[12-Dec-24 02:01 PM] ApexChat#8127
**AtomicScience**:	You have money for more

[12-Dec-24 02:01 PM] ApexChat#8127
**AtomicScience**:	And more


[12-Dec-24 02:01 PM] ApexChat#8127

[12-Dec-24 02:01 PM] ApexChat#8127
**bobnobrain**:	Problems start at the "make a profit" stage


[12-Dec-24 02:01 PM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	what lowstrife does, basically


[12-Dec-24 02:03 PM] ApexChat#8127
**CyberKrakenOriginal**:	What positive feedback loop? Eventually supply will dry up, you can only produce a finite amount of FLX in a set amount of time, and if nobody is buying because nobody can afford to buy it there's no profit


[12-Dec-24 02:03 PM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	FLX in particular has a pretty elastic demand, because you can make similar recipes without it depending on FLX price


[12-Dec-24 02:03 PM] ApexChat#8127
**CyberKrakenOriginal**:	The entire real world works on an open market, if there was such things as a positive feedback loop in an open market then the world would collapse


[12-Dec-24 02:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**AtomicScience**:	Well, there is a positive feedback loop in the real world, and antitrust law was designed specifically to combat it


[12-Dec-24 02:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**CyberKrakenOriginal**:	Exactly, if FLX is priced too high then people switch to the recipes that don't use FLX, which means demand is 0, no profit is made, so price must fall


[12-Dec-24 02:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**CyberKrakenOriginal**:	@atomic which thing on the open market in the real world has a positive feedback loop?


[12-Dec-24 02:06 PM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	@AtomicScience antitrust is only needed because companies use their monopoly in producing some products against customers; but this doesn't apply here because everything is a commodity


[12-Dec-24 02:06 PM] ApexChat#8127
**CyberKrakenOriginal**:	There is also that


[12-Dec-24 02:07 PM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	(the basis for anti-trust in the US is "hurting customers", and in the EU it's "using monopoly in a market to gain an advantage in an other market)


[12-Dec-24 02:07 PM] ApexChat#8127
**CyberKrakenOriginal**:	Anyone here can produce anything, everything is a commodity and nobody has a monopoly


[12-Dec-24 02:07 PM] ApexChat#8127
**AtomicScience**:	Well, maybe we all are customers here, since everyone is into PrUn for the fun of it


[12-Dec-24 02:09 PM] ApexChat#8127
**CyberKrakenOriginal**:	Atomic, we are also all producers, there's nothing in the game to tell you that you can't produce your own FLX and list it for less than the current ask


[12-Dec-24 02:12 PM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	the real customers are the friends we made along the way


[12-Dec-24 02:12 PM] ApexChat#8127
**AtomicScience**:	You get bogged down into the narrow definition of a monopoly as a single buyer. It's not necessarily about someone controlling 100% of the market


[12-Dec-24 02:13 PM] ApexChat#8127
**AtomicScience**:	Why can't it be about someone abusing market like this?


[12-Dec-24 02:14 PM] ApexChat#8127
**AtomicScience**:	"Anticompetitive practice", that's the term


[12-Dec-24 02:14 PM] ApexChat#8127
***Bossman3747** left.*


[12-Dec-24 02:15 PM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	you're referring to price gouging, and that's (unfortunately) legal in the real world


[12-Dec-24 02:15 PM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	(most of the time)


[12-Dec-24 02:16 PM] ApexChat#8127
**CyberKrakenOriginal**:	The point is that in this game the price has to fall, people will just use the non-FLX recipe until price drops low enough that the FLX recipe makes more than the non-FLX recipe again, or they will produce their own FLX, or people that already produce FLX will list it at progressively lower prices, the price will fall, that is a guarantee of the open market


[12-Dec-24 02:16 PM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	remember when some people bought loads of hydroalcoholic gel early in covid?


[12-Dec-24 02:17 PM] ApexChat#8127
**AtomicScience**:	Well, that's a market panic, completely different phenomenon


[12-Dec-24 02:17 PM] ApexChat#8127

[03-Jan-25 11:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**boom_badda_boom**:	There is a wide hull upgrade 3000/1000 which doubles your hull capacity but allows you to carry x6 the weight


[03-Jan-25 11:55 AM] ApexChat#8127
**boom_badda_boom**:	Or there is 2000/2000


[03-Jan-25 11:55 AM] ApexChat#8127
**boom_badda_boom**:	Or there is the option of just making your ship fly faster to do more deliveries per day by fitting basic high-g seats which is by far the cheapest at 180k


[03-Jan-25 11:55 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pomme_de_Terroriste**:	If you haven't upgraded your start ships, that's going to be your best bet. UFO Discord will have some deals.


[03-Jan-25 11:55 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pomme_de_Terroriste**:	You can do WCB upgrades on both for half the price of a new ship, and that'll double your cargo capacity (or more, depending on what you're shipping).


[03-Jan-25 11:55 AM] ApexChat#8127
**boom_badda_boom**:	With what you have to buy to go with the UFO discord the cheapest package is the wide hull one - WCB - and in total will cost you about 900k

[16-Mar-25 09:59 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	Alkali metals like Sodium and Potassium and alkaline earth metals like Calcium are not naturally found in an elemental state, they are always found in compounds that don't look or act like metals.  If the only form you'd ever seen iron in was rust, you wouldn't think of it as a metal either.

{Embed}
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carbonaceous_chondrite
Carbonaceous chondrite
Carbonaceous chondrites or C chondrites are a class of chondritic meteorites comprising at least 8 known groups and many ungrouped meteorites. They include some of the most primitive known meteorites. The C chondrites represent only a small proportion (4.6%) of meteorite falls.
Some famous carbonaceous chondrites are: Allende, Murchison, Orgueil...
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/hBIk9rMow3_1ogQVNSqSzHzHEDJsjjX--wqN9E4yoSM/https/upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/24/Allende_meteorite.jpg/1200px-Allende_meteorite.jpg

[18-Mar-25 09:59 AM] ApexChat#8127

[18-Mar-25 10:00 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Katt_Tarki**:	Thank you.


[18-Mar-25 10:02 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	It's better to think of it as a single smelting complex with a number of smelters.  You can't assign orders to individuals SMEs, but you can control how much time the complex spends on each product.


[18-Mar-25 10:02 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Katt_Tarki**:	That makes sense.


[18-Mar-25 10:03 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	and that's actually better for you, because it takes slightly more time to consume FE than to produce them


[18-Mar-25 10:04 AM] ApexChat#8127

[18-Mar-25 10:07 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Katt_Tarki**:	I think I've been playing for about a month and I'm generating enough income to stay in the black AND save a bit. [18-Mar-25 10:08 AM] ApexChat#8127

[18-Mar-25 10:10 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	I started on Vallis like you.  My initial strategy was to upcycle as much as I could, and I found that FEO > FE > STL > PT was a good way to do that.  You don't get a CoGC bonus for the BMP that produces the PT, but it uses what you can produce locally so you don't have to ship ores and metals around.


[18-Mar-25 10:11 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Retread**:	You're at the mercy of the market price for PT, but there's not much you can do to diversify in the beginning.


[18-Mar-25 10:12 AM] ApexChat#8127

**Partihrl**:	Can free users accept player contracts, or does that need PRO?


[26-Mar-25 10:19 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Luaan**:	You need to buy PRO at least once; when it runs out, you switch to BASIC instead of FREE, which allows you to accept player contracts

**Partihrl**:	Cool, good to know


[26-Mar-25 10:19 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Luaan**:	(gifted PRO doesn't count, it will drop you back to FREE when it runs out)

[31-Mar-25 06:14 PM] ApexChat#8127
**woluc**:	hi, i accidentally closed the tutorial as i was building my smelter and extractor. whats the command to reopen it?


[31-Mar-25 06:49 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Aethean**:	Look in the upper right corner and you should see "HELP: X/9". If you click that it should open the tutorial tasks in a new window. If you don't see that, click "NEW BFR" in the bottom left to open a new buffer. Type "HELP" into the command window and that should bring up the introductory tasks.

[11-Apr-25 05:23 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Luaan**:	That's something that can change many times a day :D In general, you want to keep track of the markets for all the involved goods (including worker consumables). Right now, there doesn't seem to be a good reason to build a smelter here, except to provide e.g. iron to your other factories


[11-Apr-25 05:27 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Luaan**:	Which is a huge thing, of course, because that's a _lot_ of shipping you can avoid. If I switched to making my own iron right now, I wouldn't make much extra money (not worth the cost of setup)... but it would make things a lot easier to manage and ship around overall, and it only gets better as you expand and shipping becomes more of a bottleneck (not to mention the capital tied up in all that cargo).

[12-Apr-25 04:19 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zugore**:	x/y(z), where x is available plots, y is total plots on planet (based on planet size so doesn't change), and z is ghost plots (used plots above max capacity from new player starts)
